Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 10

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 10

Expand your vocabulary with these key intermediate words essential for effective communication in various contexts.

Navigation

This is page 10 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

Example

/ɪɡˈzæmpl/

noun

A thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule.

"Can you give me an example of how to use this word?"

Synonyms: instance, illustration, sample

Category: Illustration

Experience

/ɪkˈspɪriəns/

noun, verb

Practical contact with and observation of facts or events.

"She has five years of experience in marketing."

Synonyms: knowledge, expertise, background

Category: Knowledge

Explain

/ɪkˈspleɪn/

verb

To make something clear to someone by describing it in more detail.

"The teacher will explain the new grammar rule."

Synonyms: clarify, describe, interpret

Category: Communication

Express

/ɪkˈspres/

verb

To convey a thought or feeling in words or by gestures and conduct.

"She expressed her gratitude for all the help she received."

Synonyms: convey, communicate, articulate

Category: Communication

Factor

/ˈfæktər/

noun

A circumstance, fact, or influence that contributes to a result.

"Price is an important factor when choosing a product."

Synonyms: element, component, consideration

Category: Influence

Feature

/ˈfiːtʃər/

noun, verb

A distinctive attribute or aspect of something.

"The new phone has many advanced features."

Synonyms: characteristic, attribute, quality

Category: Characteristics

Finance

/ˈfaɪnæns/

noun, verb

The management of large amounts of money; to provide funding for.

"She works in finance at a large corporation."

Synonyms: money management, funding, economics

Category: Money

Focus

/ˈfoʊkəs/

noun, verb

The center of interest or activity; to concentrate attention or effort.

"Please focus on the most important aspects of the project."

Synonyms: concentrate, center, attention

Category: Attention

Function

/ˈfʌŋkʃən/

noun, verb

An activity or purpose natural to or intended for a person or thing.

"The main function of the heart is to pump blood."

Synonyms: purpose, role, operation

Category: Purpose

Future

/ˈfjuːtʃər/

noun, adjective

The time that is to come; existing or occurring at a later time.

"We need to plan for future developments in technology."

Synonyms: tomorrow, upcoming, forthcoming

Category: Time

Global

/ˈɡloʊbəl/

adjective

Relating to the whole world; worldwide.

"Climate change is a global issue that affects everyone."

Synonyms: worldwide, international, universal

Category: World

Government

/ˈɡʌvərnmənt/

noun

The governing body of a nation, state, or community.

"The government announced new policies to help small businesses."

Synonyms: administration, authority, regime

Category: Politics
